qas.question: How many lords are usually present during assent by Commissioner?
What do the Lords Commissioners wear to a ceremony of assent?
Which commissioner reads the formal closing statement to the assention ceremony?
Which position reads the commisssion aloud during tthe ceremony?
The junior commissioner makes a statement after whom?
The king's representatives are know as whom?
How many commoners are involved in granting assent by commission?

context: When granting assent by commission, the sovereign authorises <b7_0>three or more (normally <a0_0>five<a0_0/>)<b7_0/> lords who are Privy Counsellors to grant assent in his or her name. The <b6_0><b8_0>Lords Commissioners<b8_0/><b6_0/>, as the monarch's representatives are known, wear <a1_0>scarlet parliamentary robes<a1_0/> and sit on a bench between the throne and the Woolsack. <a3_0>The <b4_0><b5_0>Lords Reading Clerk<b5_0/><b4_0/><a3_0/> reads the commission aloud; <a2_0>the senior<a2_0/> commissioner then states, "My Lords, in obedience to Her Majesty's Commands, and by virtue of the Commission which has been now read, We do declare and notify to you, the Lords Spiritual and Temporal and Commons in Parliament assembled, that Her Majesty has given Her Royal Assent to the several Acts in the Commission mentioned."
